heading: Today
text: Early clouds and flurries north giving way to sunshine north, and mostly sunny south.  Increasing afternoon clouds, with a chance of snow showers in NY into the St. Lawrence.  Much colder.  Highs in the upper teens to mid 20s north, 20s to near 30 south.  Winds west to northwest 10 to 15 mph, gusting 20 to 30 mph from the Green Mountains east, near 10 mph west, diminishing through the afternoon.

heading: Tonight
text: Partly cloudy this evening, then becoming cloudy.  Not as cold.  Any snow showers north will taper off.  Lows in the teens northeast, near 10 in the cold spots, and 20 to 25 west and south.  Winds becoming light and variable.

heading: Tuesday
text: Cloudy, with snow developing in NY into southern VT and the Berkshires, spreading north and east of I-89 midday and afternoon. Some rain possible late from Rutland south and west. Light accumulations.  Highs in the 20s to near 30 northeast, and low to mid 30s southwest.  Light winds, becoming southeast up to 10 mph from the Green Mountains west.
